definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents an aspect ratio of up to 2.76:1 that originally used three synchronized projectors.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents an aspect ratio of up to 2.76:1 that originally used three synchronized projectors.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents an aspect ratio of 2.59:1 using three synchronized projectors.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents an aspect ratio of 2.59:1 using three synchronized projectors.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that uses nine projectors for screens arranged in a circle.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that uses nine projectors for screens arranged in a circle.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that projects images of far greater size and resolution than conventional film systems.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that projects images of far greater size and resolution than conventional film systems.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film using multiple synchronized projectors.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film using multiple synchronized projectors.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film using multiple screens.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film using multiple screens.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents a wide-screen aspect ratio using Panavision anamorphic lenses.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents a wide-screen aspect ratio using Panavision anamorphic lenses.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that uses a standard projector aperture for silent film.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that uses a standard projector aperture for silent film.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that uses a standard projector aperture for film with a sound-track.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that uses a standard projector aperture for film with a sound-track.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that gives the illusion of three dimensions by using stereoscopic images.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that gives the illusion of three dimensions by using stereoscopic images.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents an aspect ratio of 2.33:1 using 35-mm film.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that presents an aspect ratio of 2.33:1 using 35-mm film.

definition[0]_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that gives the illusion of three dimensions.
ToolkitDefinition_en: A presentation format of a motion picture film that gives the illusion of three dimensions.
